intro: Vireya sanguinolenta, commonly known as the blood vireya, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-red flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is known for its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Vireya sanguinolenta is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
